intro: Pseudalcantarea grandis, commonly known as the giant rockcress, is a striking member of the Brassicaceae family native to the high Andes of South America. It is characterized by its large, showy white or purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant features a robust, upright stem with dense clusters of leaves that are often covered in a waxy coating. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and can grow up to several inches in length. Pseudalcantarea grandis thrives in cool, high-altitude environments and is adapted to withstand harsh mountain conditions.
